content:
Posted: May 27, 2015
												You know that feeling you get when you purchase a game, and it turns out to be one of the best decisions you've ever made. The combat is great, and the mechanics are cool, you play it with your friends; and you all laugh out loud "HAHAHAHA" and you say "I'm so glad we bought this game!"This game is the opposite of that... This game is probably the worst thing to ever happen to anyone....EVER, literally it's like a really really really fat guy that walks onto the train you and your friends are on, and he sits right next to you, and he smiles at you, it's a bit disconcerting, but you smile back. And then you hear it, the loudest, longest fart you've ever heard, you try to ignore it  and put your shirt over your mouth. But it doesn't help, the smell penetrates your nostrils, and seeps into your eye sockets. Your eyes start to water and your heart starts beating out of your chest, you just have to get out of there. You look back to the man sitting beside you, He's just smiling at you, his grin penetrating you skin and burrowing into your soul. Your friends start to convulse, Issac your friend since early child hood, projectile vomits across the train carriage, you are now covered im vomit. you begin to cry, the man starts to laugh. the sound like a wet towel slapping against a tiled floor, tears streak down your face and in your mind you can't help but think to yourself.....why did i buy this terrible game

												If you can pick up this game on sale for a dollar, it might be worth checking out, if you ever wanted to check out the 'zombie survival MMO experience' for cheap.(Better choice over Day-Z - along with the empty and broken promises of Day-Z devs - and H1Z1, which does not say much at all).Despite being likely the best zombie survival MMO to date, I'm going to recommend against this game, as it is plagued by lame cheaters (always has been) and the developers really do not care.Having said that, this game would be solid and damn good fun, if they only had some effective anti-cheat.* If you do decide to pick up this title *watch out for the Brazilians* and tread carfully.* Zombies are the least of your concern in a post apocalypic world where resources are limited.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												I wake up a foot or two above the ground. As I land, the world around me starts to become clear. Trees have taken over the world. I wander throughout the day with my flashlight on, until I come across what appears to be a large amount of zombies surrounding a random spot in the road where everyone has decided to park their cars and leave. I approach with caution. I run up and jump onto the back of a truck. That's when I find myself a delicious candy bar. I enjoy this sweet piece of tastiness. Then the zombies learn to climb. I bash their skulls in with my flashlight with ease. I pick up a rifle to pick off the rest. Little did I know, it had no bullets. Gun is useless. Zombies are now entirely surrounding me. I spend the next half hour breaking the heads of the zombies with my extremely durable flashlight until the coast is clear. I make a run for it. I find a farm, but unfortunately, it is filled with nothing but duct tape. I also found a glow stick, but alas, my small kindergarden backpack could not carry any more, as it was filled with tape. That's when I set out to find a home for the night. I search effortlessly, when I finally see a city. It is very close, I start to run. Suddenly, zombies start teleporting to my location. What do I do? Kill them with my flashlight. Oh no! My flashlight no longer hits where I tell it to! I swing but no matter how many times the light makes contact with the zombie, it continues to brush right through it! I am forced to run. I run to the city, finally safe. I find a revolver on the ground, good. Now I can survive better. Wait! No I can't! Sniped. My journey had ended. As I die, all of my duct tape falls out onto the ground. Then... Oh man... Then I was forced... To... Wait around 20 minutes. OR PAY TO REVIVE NOW! :DI recommend this game to anyone who loves crying and spending $20 on digital glow sticks!

content:
Posted: April 17, 2014
												Hey I am Black Lotus from the WarZ forum (ISS) now Yes I have over 8500 post there. I was recent ip banned from forum now with my new find freedom. I can finally express my true thought without restriction. After a year of playing this game, I feel I would like to express my through for the game.First off I love this game. This game could be so much fun if the developer would actually listen to me. I truly wanted this game to success. I truly do love this game. I personally spend over 100 dollar in this game. I have brought over 6 accounts and I have no regret what so ever in buying this game. This is game can exciting and rage inducing game. This game has a high risk factor which can make or break you. I personally find that there are a lot good people who play this game. I also know some of them will can also stab you in the back. One of my most negative experiences was that I find out that the dev and mods were talk crap about other player. Yes some of the people in the community are annoying but it not needs to talk crap about them. The incident with Mad Max aka Striker Cade and a new developer Artemis knives is a fine example of this. I have heard of from a ex Moderator that the dev were talking negative thing about their playerbase and daily too. It a shame this company lack of professionism to it playerbase. I have keep silent about many incident. However now that I have nothing else left. I am going to say this. They clearly didn't expect for the game to do so well. The dev have no faith in it fanbase on it forum community. I even find out that both Kewk and Zombert have talk crap about me too. ( i know you read my personal PMs too) However my love for this game have kept me silent and I do wish this game to be as big as League of Legend or even DOTA. However the dev lack of respect and faith on their community will be it downfall.I have seen multiple their fans actually tired to help make this game better. However the direction of the developer of OP production was very misleading. They have promise multiple time they will fix the issue and many time they never even try to fix the problem. Look at unstable server continue disconnection from server. There are many bugs and buggy zombie. I understand you have a small team but it over a year. we have waited over for a year for stronghold. It nothing but a death arena. I have remain positive this whole time however I am not going to sit by and watch something I care about died with a fight . I even play legit all this time. I never even cheated once in this game and I will never cheat in this game. I have been kill so many time that by hacker and I stop caring about it. I have stop caring about them now as this is a never ending battle. Yeah the dev have step up their anti cheat. Yeah Fairfight is a good anti cheat system . However this undermine by the cheap account situation. i know dev you are in need of money. This revolving door policy is not good in the long run. I know they have HWID ip banned. I have seen it in action . It can be very effective however they do not use it. Yeah it a revolving door policy.I know it long but bear with me. Support I know support is nonexistence until this year . Yeah I have sent ticket too. None were answer until this year by a real person. They close all my ticket from last year and never solve any of them. However I admit support now is a alot better and there is no more automated closed response and it a good start from there. Yes if you hacked they know and they do check ip too. So you cannot send a ticket for your friend.I even got a warning point for reporting a duper who was c-mag and was streaming it too. Yes Kewk give a warning point and I never report a duper until he quited. I give public posting about them and warn you about them. I personally took that too heart. Do you know why now there is a black market and why you are losing money now. I have warned you that duper existed. They are even showing it the public and it so easy to find it too. You can hide on your forum but not the internet. This reward of new duping method for 1000000Gc is a joke and no one will report it now. You have made people in fear of report their finding. I personally know of only one method right now . However it not worth duping anymore. As sniper rifle were duped like it was in style and people have over 100 sniper in their legit account lockbox. I can say one thing was it worth silenting your loyal fanbase. The forum was a treasure of info. Even hacker announce their attack against you daliy. I have over 8500 post and I read the forum and never forget them. They would make spam site and hack login and many other thing. Almost half of the trader there was a hacker or is hacker. I know them by their name. I personally feel that you should bring back gc trading at least then you can make money from that. Instead of them using the black market. I have many thing I wish to tell you however I want to leave it one positive note. Dev and staff of OP Production this game is wonderful and it even could have been a great success However you just keep making the same mistake over and over again. I have tell you the flaw of them. If you choose to listen or don't. I personally hope do success but I believe your flaws will caught up to you. Love you lot Black Lotus

content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												I had fun playing this game but I like to grind and survive. Don't trust the pictures where you see a  lot of people laying out zombies with rifles and such. Ammo, for guns, are weapon specific and incredibly rare and not worth using on zombies. You'll have better luck finding duplicate weapons and emptying it than you will finding a loose magazine.You will spend your first part of the game finding remote spawn points for food, water, and loot and server hopping to other almost empty servers to empty that same spot over and over.Then you'll spend time trying to not get killed by other people as you loot more dangerous areas(airport) where the somewhat good drops are and about 10 million zombies are found...Not a long term game to play, I wouldn't recommend it or expect a friend to play it with me.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												Great idea, TERRIBLE! execution.This game is truely terrible... It needs to be burned with fire asap.It is/was nothing more then a simple cash grab game... it came out over-hyped, didnt diliver what it promised (had alot of false advertisement, and was removed from steam twice lol).Its a terrible game cashing in on the "zombie" phase that everyone is on atm.I was an original backer of this game and played during early alpha testing, and back then they had an excuse to have a less then good game since its in alpha. It looked promosing.But not much has changed since alpha for the better...-Graphics are nothing to talk about. Looks like some crappy game from 2004 when on max settings.-Audio is terrible.-The physics/game engine is just poor...-Hackers/cheaters galore.-From what i hear, A LOT of legit players are being banned becuase of their crappy ban system (i think a 5yo can find a better way to stop cheaters... Want to know how they stop cheaters? they place items in areas which are impossible to get to, and if you pick up that item you get banned. But its so poorly done, that these items can be picked up through walls or the celing of building if u jump)-Terrible devs, terrible customer supportTo give you mroe insight on this company.I payed $25 for a game in aplha. It was released for $15 on release... (who knew aplha costs more then release!)On top of that, i literally had to fight for WEEKS to get a free copy of the steam version, since i wanted the game on steam...Trying to get a $10 refund was beating a dead horse though...To give you a little more information (btw the game used to be called WarZ)https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infestation:_Survivor_Stories#Reception"In October 2012 executive producer Sergey Titov referred to spawn campers in The War Z as "♥♥♥♥♥♥s" in a forum post"their PR team teird to cover for him and say, o he isnt against homosexuality... but he couldnt come out and say it >.>Remember that is the EXECUTIVE PRODUCER! not just some lowely low wage employee or forum mod or something...That would be like the CEO of walmart calling african americans the N word... how much would u respect them if they did something like that?....The list goes on, and im sure there is WAY more not being listed on this wiki.Also know "PCPowerplay gave the game a zero (out of ten), the only zero in the magazine's history"the game is only $15, maybe less if on sale. ya its not much money, and im sure you may get a few dollars worth of cheap fun from the game.BUT i would NOT suggest supporting these kind of developers or companies with even a SINGLE PENNY!

												This game was very fun for me for a while then i realized how many people actually do have hacks and esp's. The servers are not well kept and are filled with snipers with aimbots or speed hacks. There is not much to do except collect gear and run through the world and get mad ever time a hacker walks through the wall and kills you. Its only 5 dollars though so if you looking for a cheap way to get really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off very quickly then ISS is the game for you. The only up side to all this NOTHING there is no upside. I have a good bit of time on this game and ton's of gear but still its really not all worth it even with a new map there is still nothing to do. The developers really need to get there Sh$$ togeather and fix the real problems before they add things into the game. The Devs are not very nice either. They are very money hungry they took the survival away from the game when they put an in game store into the mix. So if your a hacker or just have money to spare you can just gear up and get all the ammo and armor/meds that you want and never loose. My conclusion to all this ramble is if you want to get a cheap survival game for 5 bucks please please please dont buy this one i can assure you it is a huge waist of your time.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2015
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2014
												               To be honest, I really don't mind playing I:SS. I picked this up during the summer sale a year ago I think, and I enjoyed playing it for the first hour. After that, the magic's gone. Everyone is constantly paranoid and the KoS is not a problem, it's a fact. I can't remember the last time someone actually talked to me in this without immediately shooting me or getting their friends to kill me. Not to mention the lack of communication is kinda a bust, the majority of people would rather kill you for your flashlight and Granola bars, then proceed to t-bag you and write 2nd grade insults at you.                In short, the gameplay is at times frustrating/painful, but makes up for when you get items, the developers (In my opinion) are getting alot better with the updates/feedback/community for the game, but the weakest link in this has to be the few ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s that kill for♥♥♥♥♥♥all and ruin the experience for many.                 With that said and done, I don't recommend I:SS with the amount of♥♥♥♥♥♥you have to deal with as a new player coming into this game, but play at your own risk.

												Infestation: Survivor Stories, previous name WarZ. Because the new film "World War Z", the game must rename, so I:SS Is new name, but is same bulls*it like WarZ. Let me tell you why not buy this game.Gameplay:You are going to spawn somewhere, u got few choices, random spawn points, but its only few of them... Some town, mostly PvP town, some forest or near the safe zone.You are going to loot something, like towns, military bases and more. But u got enemies! 1.) Retar*ed zombies and retar*ed players.Players in this game.... thats a worst community in games history! If u play DayZ, u will see reality of apocalypse, helping each other, making a new friends, not like in I:SS.... u will meet someone, *bam* u are dead.... Zombies.. #hahaha      -► Zombies are so retar*ed, if u are in the house, they will searching for the main entrance of the building for over then 10 mins! My score - 2/10 - Very, VERY BAD GAMEPositives/negatives+Positive:If u are playing the zombie game for the 1st time, u like Deathmatches, this game is for you.Not bad items, in game its lot of items, some cool stuff!-Negative:- Retar*ed Zombies- retar*ed players- Pay 2 win!!!- PVP, no communication- Kill on sight- Graphic - Gameplay- Combat system- Updates of the game... they are almost more retartded then the zombies in the game!- It cost 13 Euro! !WARNING! PLEASE DONT BUY THIS GAME!

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.' Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. To this day, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												Wow, dont you hate this game? I'm so glad that I only paid 1.99 dollars....I wouldn't invest in this game, based on so many things. I know after reading the reviews I should not have bought it. I mean first time playing, hit by a zombie like maybe 3 time at night, and I was dead. Then I thought well let me just jump back in I won't make the same mistake. Oh you can get back in... about 8 minutes or pay to revive him. EIGHT FRIGGEN MINUTES!?!?! WTF IS THAT? Ok now I get back in, I decided that I would find at least a melee weapon, and I find a barn, run inside, find a golf club, grab it, and three zombies from all the open doors corner me. I killed two trying to get out, and as I exit , one zombie kills me with one swipe. Do you think I wait for another eight minutes....F*#@k no!!Come on guys(developers) are you sure this was your goal to create a game? I think this is a make the money off as many gamers as possible and run (abandon) it. I feel like I've been lied to. This is not even an early release..this is a rip off!!!!!!!Do not waste one single penny!!!!!!!!! Its worthless..worst game I've ever played. I repeat DO NOT GIVE YOUR MONEY AWAY TO PEOPLE THAT NO NOTHING ABOUT GAMING!!

												I bought this game awhile back when it was on sale for $3.74 and to be honest that was the worst waste of money in my life. This game is really horrid. Sure some stuff is easy enough to obtain if you don't get randomly skull crushed by a flash light. The only good thing that I thought this game did was they actually made the zombies slow. That was it! The controls are clunky the weapon collsion with the zombies is horrible. I mean when I hit a zombie with a hammer or with a boat oar their head should♥♥♥♥♥♥back a little. Personally the Walking Dead Survival Instinct is a better game than this one. Their both garbage, but at least the WD has a little bit of a story and the controls are slightly better. Really this game should just be a free to play; then maybe they could get more customers and make improvements.

												Infestation: Survivor Stories is a good game for 30 minutes then it becomes a bad looking game ! The textures off most objects are smudged/blurred. This feels like a cheap, low budget, copy of DayZ.There are 1st and 3rd person views. The zombies are fast and it is nearly impossible to run away from, they can take you out in 2-3 hits, then you die, which then makes you have to wait a long time for your player to respawn.There are players who play this game and will always win in fights unless you have the right equipment.The game is alot of money and is best to get when on a deal.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												This game is driven by micro-transactions in game.  Those who spend $$ get better gear and ammo and those who don't are taken out by those who do.  Poor programming, only a few types of zombies and very very predictable spawns.   Save your money and either invest in Arma II and get the DayZ mod -  the ORIGINAL zombie survival MMO - or invest in the new DayZ Standalone.  10x more world to discover, MUCH better detail and graphics, and MUCH better gameplay.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
												My wife and I have spend hours on this game, several hundred dollars only to be let down over and over. This game has the potential to be so much more but with poor management this game has sunk beyond what any words could really say. The pvp aspect of the game sucks because you might end up being ganked and drop all of your hard earned gear yet at the same time if you want a PVE area you end up having to pay an outrageous price for the "Private" server of theirs then that fully kills the entire MMO part of the game. Seems to me they could do as many MMO's have done and made a pvp system where the game has spots that are contested or something or have PVE servers that allow you to enjoy the game. I am now holding off on putting any more life into this game and waiting on H1Z1 from Sony. ISS had great potential yet they let it fail....

content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												The WarZ or... "Infestation: Survivor Stories" (Renamed because WarZ are infamous for some of the stupid and wrong things they have done so they're tricking you by changing the title.)I picked it up for a buck, still not worth it. The devs for this game are just downright sickening in their treatment of players, they have thretened to blacklist their credit cards, they have thretened lawsuits against people who critisized the game, they're pathedic and I feel terrible for supporting them, even if it is just with one dollar, but that's another dollar that's lining these greedy, lying scumbags' pockets. Cons:1.) They lie on the recomended system requirements, I run a machine slightly better than those and no, 1-5 FPS is not acceptable2.) The options menu is absolutly terrible, Terraria has a better options menu and It's a 2D sidescroller3.) The zombies are ridiculously overpowered, they run faster, they do insane amounts of damage and infect you, and unless you have quite a bit of money on you, you have to pay to cure your character4.) I paid for the title and now you want me to go "Premium" for no extra content, only free weapons and lower teir currency... money grabbing slimeballs5.) The game's absolutly full of hackers, I mean, ridiculously full of hackers.6.) The doesn't allow you to customize a render distance7.) The game boasts features it doesn't even have yet8.) The game changed their name to "infestation: survivor stories" But the devs were too lazy to rename the gamefiles so it's listed as "The War Z" 9.) Instead of giving us a large map they gave us a decant sized map and made the player slow as all hell, lazy, lazy devs.Pros:1.) They have quite a few resolutions however, if you have one of the larger moniters (IE that 2000x???? resolution) You're fresh out of luck.2.) When it isn't spazzing out, flickering, clipping through objects and dropping your framerate to downright ridiculous numbers some of the effects look like a moderately pretty PS2 title... (oh that's not what they were going for?)3.)...That's about it... yea, To wrap it up:The devs are corrupt, sneaky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s, and don't get me wrong, I usually have the upmost respect for the devs however this? No... Your title is unfit for purpose, this game is a scam, they lie about quite a few features of the game, most of those aren't even implimented while others are just downright broken when they are in, the gameplay is tedious and frustrating and it's just a downright terrible title. Save yourselves the trouble and go buy the Arma II collection or the DayZ standalone if you're looking for a zombie survival horror post apocalyptic-y game. This is not worth your time and certainly not worth mine.

Quick SummaryA cheaper alternative to DayZ. You get what you pay for.Purchase Verdict: No (Unless it is on a really great sale)Points of Interest-Let me preface this by saying that I know an update came out recently that changed a lot of mechanics, so take what follows with a grain of salt, as I have not played the new update.-Pay-2-Win and play with large groups, otherwise you're done for. Community of trolls and greedy people.-Predictable and oftentimes glitchy zombie AI-Items oftentimes too scarce to even survive.-Death timers, anyone? Have fun waiting thirty minutes to be able to play again.

Have fun waiting thirty minutes to be able to play again.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												This game is driven by micro-transactions in game.  Those who spend $$ get better gear and ammo and those who don't are taken out by those who do.  Poor programming, only a few types of zombies and very very predictable spawns.   Save your money and either invest in Arma II and get the DayZ mod -  the ORIGINAL zombie survival MMO - or invest in the new DayZ Standalone.  10x more world to discover, MUCH better detail and graphics, and MUCH better gameplay.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 21, 2013
												This is just WarZ with a new name. DO NOT BUY.It's much more fun (and free) to browse the forums and read all the hate posted there, or to follow the patch notes, because I'm honestly convinced the devs are trying their best to somehow make the game worse-- and bravo if that's the case. How they haven't quit or offed themselves from sheer shame for making this abomination leads me to believe that they have no dignity, self-respect or knowledge of right and wrong. I'm serious. They should be making daily apologies to all the deranged players that have such poor taste in gaming or are just so easily entertained that they actually enjoy this offensive excuse for a game. Anyone who is associated in the production of this game should be laughed out of any future game development career. (Expect whoever did the gun modeling / gun sounds. That isn't too shabby, but you'd never know because you rarely fire a shot.) There is not a single redeeming quality to this plague. The concept was torn from DayZ, the devs make empty promises, the support is nonexistant, there are hackers in every server, there is FPS lag no matter your specs or quality settings, your account infomation is not at all safe and the prices for items ingame are inexcusable. Please look into "WarZ emulators" if you must try this game. The source code was ripped a while back and several emulators popped up. The emulators not only run the game better, but have more features and less bugs. They're also free, which is good because you do NOT want to give your money to these folks.

												PVP deathmatch - no progression. You lose all your hard earned gear and items on death. Zombies are there just like trees and rocks and don't matter much to all the KOS (kill on sight) players. There are no PVE servers nor is there anyway to turn off PVP. There is zero ability to play this cooperatively with you friends in order to survive in a persistent world (aka no RPG, PVE).

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												I will keep this review brief, though i feel for this game it is a public service that needs to be done. Stay away from this game, you dont want it. Most people are aware of the terribly scammy practices Hammerpoint Interactive has engaged in, but for everyone one who knows there may very well be 100 who dont know.So, i'm gonna just run down the list in no particular order: Dedicated servers were promised, and that promise was not delivered upon. Enforcement of game rules and punishment of cheaters was also promised, yet there are plenty of people who use wallhacks/ aimbot (and I'm far from trigger-happy when it comes to accusing people of such things, because I fully realize that there are people who are better than me at videogames).A significantly larger amount of player slots per server was promised, compared to the less-than-128player-servers we currently have.And the real big one that grinds my gears? The game was originally advertised as being totally free to play with the purchasable items being cosmetic. this is something that they refuse to enact in practice, as you can buy all sorts of spiffy backpacks, guns, and blades (rentals too, of course) and some of these weapons can never be found in game, as well as being vastly stronger than their non cash-shop weapons.in short, a scam by any other name is still a scam.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 3, 2014
												There are no ordinary zombies... Instead of throwing themselves at you with tooth and claw, these mean sum'♥♥♥♥♥es fly into an epilectic fit of rage and use their telekinetic mastery to end you without even touching.There are no ordinary players... Instead of A-holes holding you up or killing you for your goods, many of these guys don only the finest invisibilty cloaks, making nothing but their backpack and flashlight visible before beating you mercilessly with it (The torch, not the backpack. I think). These are no ordinary micro-transactions... Instead of being the alternative of infinite-houred grinding, the MT's make you pay for pointless misc's that you'll use or lose within moments (Ah, Capitalism).These are no ordinary physics... Instead of fall damage happening after large drops, or being able to climb up onto cars for protection, or... just... just ♥♥♥♥ all that. Die from jumping down a stair, let the telekinetic zombies just kill you through anything, just anything that makes things more frustrating.WarZ (Oops, sorry Dev's), all jokes aside, is a ♥♥♥♥ing mess. Besides what I've mensioned there's graphics, controversy, loot, weapons etc that all stink. Stear clear.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												I brought Infestation: Survival Stories back when it was known as The Warz i got the pleasure of taking part in the alpha stage of the game which was freaking awesome there was always that surprise of coming across another player and having the choice of if you should partner up or take him/her down and scavange for the loot they drop but as time went on the game suddenly started to loose its way due to the fact that theres still only 2 maps and even with the Fairfight Anti-Hack System theres still tons and i mean TONS of hackers still in this game using aimbots and esp which takes all the fun out of this game pretty much 90% of this game has hackers on every server and even if they get banned they just buy a new account as the price of the game is dirt cheap. Pros+ Hours Spent Playing+ Zombies+ PVP+ Clans / Groups+ Map SizesCons- Anti Hack System (Need a Better One)- Aimbot & ESP- No New Maps- Devs Shouldnt Have Left Alpha EarlyOverall Score: 2 / 10

content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
												Absolute garbage. I can't believe I believed my friends when they picked this up. Glitchy, poor animations, and much slower and incomplete than DayZ. Zombies are difficult to kill, and not because of their abilities, amount of health, or movement - but because of poor hit detection, hit radius, and other aspects that were poorly programmed (The animations and hit registration don't match up aesthetically) You clip on objects that you shouldn't clip on, and don't clip through things you would think would stop you. Don't waste your money, even if it's $2.67. Edit: Furthermore, I recently went back to try and give it a second chance, since I had already given the developer my money, and found out that I was permabanned for this comment. Now they have my money and have technically robbed me of the experience (or lack-there-of) that I paid for.They've refused to respond to my tickets. Spiteful, poor development, etc. I honestly don't wish negative things on people or businesses often, but their product and business practices have convinced me that these people don't deserve jobs in product development and I hope reading this will deter as many purchasers as possible to prevent this developer from getting any further. They already believe they're immune to proper practices, clearly, and if they gather enough money they'll just be in the position they want to be in: too big to fail. Vote with your money, and put your vote somewhere that it will count (Which is definitely not in infestation survivor stories)

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												So I had put off buying this game due to all the horrible reviews, metacritic rating, and the fact the developers basically p*ssed all over loyal players/paying supports of previous games(War Inc) but I desided to give it a shot anyway since it was on sale for $3. Let me start by saying most of the horrible reviews are true.-Graphics?Low quality and poorly optimzied. That means it's not super pretty but still runs slowly.-Sound?Your own SFX(footsteps, splashing,etc..) are way too loud if you have SFX set to a level so they actually help you detect threats. Sound also doesn't seem to be optimized properlly. Locating something by sound is hit or miss.-World?The map is very large. With lots of locations to explore. It would probably take near an hour to walk from one corner to the other. That's great but it can be VERY inconvient is there is no quick travel or selective spawning. But ultimatly there is still only one map. There also aren't that many building models and you will see things reused a lot.-GamePlayExploring, avoiding zombies, collecting supplies. All fun. Ranged combat is fairly tuned as it was ported directly from War Inc. Melee combat is horribly simple and poorly done on top. Zombie AI is horrible. They get stuck. Can't climb anything over 2ft.-Community?The game has a fairly large community that usually fills a couple of the 100 player servers constantly with lots of smaller servers as well. However, the majority of those players have a kill on sight attitude. Youre not likely to make many friends you didn't bring with you.-Grouping?There is a basic group system which allows group chat and disables "friendly fire." There is no easy way to simply join and play with your friends. Due to the prementioned huge map and random spawning it's very likely that you will join a server and be near the people you actually want ro play with.-Pay to Win?Yes. The game is Buy to Play and Pay to Win. Supplies(food, water,bullets) are not easy to come by in game but for a couple of dollars you can easily stock up on what would other wise take several hours to gather if youre lucky.-Fun?Strange but Yes. The game is FAR from polished but if the stars align and you manage to meet up with your friend(s) on an low-medium populated server there is much fun to be had from the sandbox elements combined with lite PvP. -Recommend?I would recommend buying this game. On sale. Don't spend over $5. Sure it can be fun but it's the type of fun you would expect from a low budget indie game, which Infestation is not. There are just to many things wrong and the developers can not be trusted to give the game longevity or proper support(see War Inc.)

												Ehmmmmmmm. How about just NO. I have spend about 2.5 hours just trying to connect to any server to play. After that i actually got in a server and played about 20 mins. First of all Im in Europe but the game decides I should connect to a US server in quick join. After I spawn in, I ran around in the woods for about 5 mins but there was not 1 zombie to be seen. As far as my experience goes, zombies are only in the towns. As I ran into a town, I encountered a zombie. The only thing they start you with is a flashlight and some food and banage. I spend about 2-3 mins punching the same zombie just to kill it. I have picked up a gun and tried to use it. There was no animation what so ever when you shoot it, it only bounds your screen up a little. This is the point when i decided to quit the game and say...... just NO. I would recommend staying as far away from this game as possible. But if you looking for the worst game I strongly recommend this.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
												I played this before it came to steam and then a little after it released to steam. I CAN NOT recommend this game to anyone. I payed 20 bucks for their "pioneer" pack back when they were still in beta. I would suggest you stay away from this game and/or anything this company/developers make. The whole things feels like a cash grab. I was banned early on during the beta for no reason, I was using a tree for cover when someone killed me and said I was cheating.... I was banned shortly after. either way, there are MUCH better survivals out with DayZ and all the others that came out in 2016.To my knowledge no other survival game charges you to revive so you can play again after you die. I completely understand the microtransactions for cosmetics but if you're going to charge me to play after I died... no thanks.. feels like something from a mobile game (pay for energy to continue playing)just spend your money on something else, there are plenty of other survivals that are MUCH better

content:
Posted: June 13, 2014
												I do not reccomend this game for two reasons: the gameplay and the community. Of course, the gameplay is fun for the first two weeks or so, and I'm still playing the game, but I must say, the game gets boring when you lag spike every minute and the game crashes every 5 minutes. Crashing is a huge huge downside of the game, you crash whenever youre killing a zombie or getting in a car and then you restart the game, and boom youre dead, and youve lost all the loot that you have earned for the past (well 5 minutes). A fair warning to those who buy this game: have a friend who owns a server, or get one yourself. DO NOT trust ANYONE on this game unless you know them. I say this because 99.9% of players will hunt you down and kill you without a thought. Once again, if you do get this game, rent a server or find a password for a server.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2013
												Grande ideia para um jogo. Você pega a sobrevivência zumbie do Mod "DayZ" do game Arma II, e transformá-lo em um MMO, onde você pode lutar contra outros jogadores ou até mesmo criar um grupo e limpar cidades e locais infestados de zumbies. No entanto, o desenvolvimento irrita seus fãs impacientes, por causa do seu desenvolvimento lento, a falta de informar a comunidade de mudanças, e não entregar certas promessas. Muitos jogadores afirmam que é apenas em versão beta do game, mas os desenvolvedores não conseguem fazer testes suficientes. Em vez disso, testam a jogabilidade sem usar o feedback da comunidade. Grande ideia e conceito, mas a má execução. Gostei de comprar este jogo pelo valor que paguei e não me arrependo, por causa de seu potencial.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Totally NOT worth the $3.74 price tag, it's not even worthy of the $1.99 Daily deal that had passed. Infestation: Survivor Stories, or WarZ is a cheap recreation of DayZ that had been done in-order to try and leech off the successful sales of it's competitors. The game features very poorly worked on codes and excessive and frustrating, sometimes game-breaking glitches/bugs.Pros:1. Is a great way to work up a rage-enducing therapy.2. Can be gifted to someone you absolutely despise3. Relatively cheap, and can be used to farm some Steam XPCons:1. Excessive number of upseting, and game-breaking bugs/glitches2. Greedy Microtransaction system that requires you to either wait 20 minutes to play, or pay $5.00 to play then.3. Coding is poorly done, making it easily manipulated, and therefore a Security Risk.4. A developer whom worked on this game, also developed Big Rigs: Off the Road racing, google it.5. The entire game itself is a Scam.But don't just take my word for it, read the many other reviews for this game and look into this game, perhaps it may just pique your interest, although I greatly doubt that this game has a long life-span left.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												OK, so I started watching a few vid of Frankie on a Dayz mod of Arma 2.  Thought it was cool and bought the game, it was really hard to get on a server.  Then I found out about WARZ.  This was good because you could actually melee a zombie.  Then I found weapons and ammo and other goodies.  It was hard to find these items and everyone seemed to be paying before I did.  Ran into a few players and learned the hard way, not to trust people.  Later on I gave the benefit of a doubt and trust and got killed for it.  New maps vehicles added. and now Caliwood.  Over all, I like this game, it soothes my zombie craving.  I have to learn to be a better PVP player.  So used to console games not used to the PC style and controls.  I give this gamea  8 or of 10 .  With hackers on, I would give this game a 4 out of 10.   Get ride of these guys.  What's the point in aimbot?  where's the challenge?  I suck at PVP, but I don't cheat.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
												Game Pros• Open world• Multiplayer• Grouping System• Looting• Day/Night Cycle• Vehicles (Ground only)Game Cons• Developers ignore community• Slow Spawning/loading times • Un-balanced map/loot• Horrible Optomization • Hackers/Script users• Un-Polished Character models• Broken PromisesRelateable Games• NetherConclusionInfestation: Survivor Stories turned out to be a let down. Sure, some people have fun. But the majority despises it. The only time I remember enjoying myself in it, was upon release, hence the 200+ hours I have in game from forever ago. In the beginning it had a lot of hope, but it's nothing but a deathmatch game now. Score20/100(If you found this review helpful, consider giving it a thumbs up!)

content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												Everyone should buy this game. Not to necessarily install and play, but to own the worst mmo in the history of gaming. It would be safe to say this will remain the worst mmo in my entire life. The time and effort spent to make this game would have been better spent playing games to understand what might make one fun. It is a great concept, a mmo based around zombies, raiding other players for supplies. I believe if they reduced the respawn time,  and balance weapons such that anyone might have some kind of chance, the game could possibly be a little fun anyhow. graphic arent great, but would serve their purpose. It just comes down to promising to take your kids you disney world, but instead taking them mcdonalds playland. I am not even sure you would like it if it was the first and only game you have played. There are hugely epic mmos and great zombie games, and this is neither. I hope the two come together, forming survival parties, going through ruins looking for supplies and avoiding, or killing zombies would be lots of fun.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2014
												Putting the controversy aside, judging the game on its own merits, this is still not a good game. It suffers from poor controls, bugs, terrible AI and subpar graphics. Try getting into a car. If you get the opportunity, just try it. Have fun with that, because you're going to be there for a while. You have to look in a very exact spot, in the centre of the cars front, somewhere between the front seats. Then you have to run against the car, back and forth, grinding against its surface, until you've kind of glitched yourself into it. For a split second you'll get a prompt to enter, so you better be ready to press the button, provided you know which one you have to press. For minutes, you'll aproach the car from different angles, aim at different point of the car, grind yourself into it, climb it, hit it out of frustration, and missing button prompts. When you finally get in, you'll realise that cars in Infestation do not controll with WASD. They controll with the arrow keys. But this will not matter for long. As soon as you get to an elevated part of the road, you'll find it has collapsed. Now, you might think you might be able to make it to the other side if you charge at it at full speed. You won't. You see, if there is even the tiniest object in the way, your car can't pass it. See a gap between 2 cars you think you can easily fit through? You can't.After ultimately giving up on the car, you'll make your way into the city on foot, fighting a few zombies on the way (circle strafing is perhaps a more apropriate description. Fight would imply actual combat). Here you'll find the games strongest part. The worn down, flooded city I got to, actually looked pretty gorgeous. It was overgrown with vines, large gaping holes in buildings, and water covered streets. It is a shame that such a sight has to grace such a terrible game. Then you'll start asking yourself; "did the zombies cause the flood?" "did they destroy the road?" "did they put the holes in the houses?". Perhaps there's an answer to that in the game. But at that point, you're no longer playing the game. In fact, you've probably uninstalled the game at this point.You see, this game isn't just bad because of the controversy and the micro transactions. It isn't bad because of the unjustified bans during the beta. It isn't bad because it is a ripoff, or the promissed features missing from the game. It is bad because it is a bad game. It tries to be DayZ, but that is not the problem. The problem is that it doesn't commit to it like DayZ. DayZ is ruthless. It is hard. The axe is heavy, and can't be swung fast. Gear is hard to find, and is often located in dangerous areas. Infestation feels very light weight in comparison. You spawn with bandages, gear is everywhere, there are very few players to kill you, the zombies, while being able to take a lot of hits, provided you haven't found a weapon yet, are easily killed by just circling them. If they can't hit you, they don't provide a threat. Infestation doesn't have the lingering threat of injury, food poisoning, blood loss, hunger and dangerous encounters with players, and the stress that comes with those things. This is what makes DayZ great. It is the reason you can't make a "DayZ lite" for more casual players, because you lose what made it great in the process. DayZ may suffer from clunky controlls, but contrary to popular belief, the game itself is not clunky. When you get used to its controlls, it is smooth sailing from there. Smooth sailing with the constant threat of death blowing in the wind...Infestation is a game wich suffer from many problems. But more than anything, it suffers from the very fabric of its existance. The idea and concept it was build on. The game is a house built with poor features on unstable, flawed-by-design foundations. In the absence of DayZ's ruthless, unforgiving environment, Infestation provides nothing as a suitible replacement. It is a poor mimic, with watered down mechanics and nothing but superficial imitations of DayZ's ruthlessnes, with none of the weight. No matter what angle you aproach it, Infestation: Survivor Stories is a broken game, whether it be mechanically, by design or as an imitation. It doesn't hold up against DayZ, and it doesn't hold up on its own. All of this is made blatantly obvious in less than an hour of playing. Don't let the title fool you, it was, still is, and will always be the WarZ, and it still suffers from the same problems.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2014
												Best experience ever! I approached the supermarket, starving and willing to devour any scrap leftover. I noticed a granola bar, and I became filled with joy and relief. Suddenly, a floating construction hat came into view at the end of the aisle. I stared, wondering if I was going insane, or if my hunger was really this bad. The strange emptiness was holding something, a flashlight. It approached me, raised the flashlight, and brought it down on my head with titan- force, leaving nothing but bloody, bruised, and mushy flesh. I collapsed, embracing death's cold grip. The last thing I saw was that thing eating MY granola bar. 10/2 wuld bang.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2014
												I do not reccomend this game for two reasons: the gameplay and the community. Of course, the gameplay is fun for the first two weeks or so, and I'm still playing the game, but I must say, the game gets boring when you lag spike every minute and the game crashes every 5 minutes. Crashing is a huge huge downside of the game, you crash whenever youre killing a zombie or getting in a car and then you restart the game, and boom youre dead, and youve lost all the loot that you have earned for the past (well 5 minutes). A fair warning to those who buy this game: have a friend who owns a server, or get one yourself. DO NOT trust ANYONE on this game unless you know them. I say this because 99.9% of players will hunt you down and kill you without a thought. Once again, if you do get this game, rent a server or find a password for a server.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												OK, so I started watching a few vid of Frankie on a Dayz mod of Arma 2.  Thought it was cool and bought the game, it was really hard to get on a server.  Then I found out about WARZ.  This was good because you could actually melee a zombie.  Then I found weapons and ammo and other goodies.  It was hard to find these items and everyone seemed to be paying before I did.  Ran into a few players and learned the hard way, not to trust people.  Later on I gave the benefit of a doubt and trust and got killed for it.  New maps vehicles added. and now Caliwood.  Over all, I like this game, it soothes my zombie craving.  I have to learn to be a better PVP player.  So used to console games not used to the PC style and controls.  I give this gamea  8 or of 10 .  With hackers on, I would give this game a 4 out of 10.   Get ride of these guys.  What's the point in aimbot?  where's the challenge?  I suck at PVP, but I don't cheat.

Posted: November 26, 2016
												Game Pros• Open world• Multiplayer• Grouping System• Looting• Day/Night Cycle• Vehicles (Ground only)Game Cons• Developers ignore community• Slow Spawning/loading times • Un-balanced map/loot• Horrible Optomization • Hackers/Script users• Un-Polished Character models• Broken PromisesRelateable Games• NetherConclusionInfestation: Survivor Stories turned out to be a let down. Sure, some people have fun. But the majority despises it. The only time I remember enjoying myself in it, was upon release, hence the 200+ hours I have in game from forever ago. In the beginning it had a lot of hope, but it's nothing but a deathmatch game now. Score20/100(If you found this review helpful, consider giving it a thumbs up!)

												I don't see how anyone could hate this game... here are some pros:- The game only crashes every two hours- The game is a pay to win (gotta pay if you want to respawn, or you'll have to wait an hour)- The chances of you getting banned are totally random so there isn't much risk if you're a hacker- Almost half of your deaths can be from hackers- Your fps might drop if you go into cities, but who cares? the risk is worth finding a chemlight- With real money, you can buy any item you want from the in-game store- The loading screen is only 5-10 minutes long.- Last time i played, the hunger and thirst meters didn't even work, so don't worry about keeping them up.- ps hit me up if you want me to update the list with anymore information.

content:
Posted: February 22
Product received for free
WarningI rewrote this after my intial review was missing. Prob due to the game changing names again. This game comes in many foul flavors such as WarZ, Infestation Surviver Stories (now classic wtf?), Romero's Aftermath (because WarZ/ISS was so bad lets do it again with less microtransactions), Infestation World (we couldn't even this this on Steam), Infestation The New Z (same game with improved business model), Shattered Skies (same game but in a space theme and no micro transactions), Last Man Standing (poor copy H1Z1 KotK and The Culling). All of these unfinished games use many of the same assets, and are on the same graphically handicapped engine. Some of the titles are almost exactly the same game.  Expect game breaking bugs, hackers, bad graphics, and poor performance. Pay MeThe game has the absolute worst micro transactions I have ever seen in a game. Pay real money to respawn... F*%@ no! Buy cosmetic items with real money just to be looted and taken by other players... WTF? Buy weapons and ammo with real money to kill the spawn camper when you pay me real money to respawn... Get the picture?  The last two titles (Shattered Skies and Last Man Standing) at least have done away with the micro transactions for the moment. ConclusionBe cautious of anything these guys develope/produce: OP Productions and Free Reign Entertainment, both companies founded by Sergey Titov, a man credited for making one of the worst games ever, Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing (2003).

content:
Posted: October 21, 2016
												I have 287 games in my Steam library as of the moment I'm writing this. Most of them I love, like or just plain enjoy, while others are what you would concider "mishap purchases". There has been only one time, however, when I've felt so disgusted, and betrayed by my, albeit a bit naïve, purchase of this game. Zombie survival games where the "♥♥♥♥♥♥quot;. Everyone and their grandmothers were playing DayZ! Let's make a game that capitalizes on that! Let's lie to our audience. Let's turn  guns and ammo into micro-transactions. Let's create no-kill zones with only on entry/exit point that people can camp outside of, killing people as the go outside.I'm proud to say that this game no longer tarnishes my Steam library with it's filth, as I personally contacted Steam support to have them permanently remove this game without a refund.These games are cancer. (I should now... And I still played ARK...)

												I do not reccomend this game for two reasons: the gameplay and the community. Of course, the gameplay is fun for the first two weeks or so, and I'm still playing the game, but I must say, the game gets boring when you lag spike every minute and the game crashes every 5 minutes. Crashing is a huge huge downside of the game, you crash whenever youre killing a zombie or getting in a car and then you restart the game, and boom youre dead, and youve lost all the loot that you have earned for the past (well 5 minutes). A fair warning to those who buy this game: have a friend who owns a server, or get one yourself. DO NOT trust ANYONE on this game unless you know them. I say this because 99.9% of players will hunt you down and kill you without a thought. Once again, if you do get this game, rent a server or find a password for a server.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 16, 2013
												Grande ideia para um jogo. Você pega a sobrevivência zumbie do Mod "DayZ" do game Arma II, e transformá-lo em um MMO, onde você pode lutar contra outros jogadores ou até mesmo criar um grupo e limpar cidades e locais infestados de zumbies. No entanto, o desenvolvimento irrita seus fãs impacientes, por causa do seu desenvolvimento lento, a falta de informar a comunidade de mudanças, e não entregar certas promessas. Muitos jogadores afirmam que é apenas em versão beta do game, mas os desenvolvedores não conseguem fazer testes suficientes. Em vez disso, testam a jogabilidade sem usar o feedback da comunidade. Grande ideia e conceito, mas a má execução. Gostei de comprar este jogo pelo valor que paguei e não me arrependo, por causa de seu potencial.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2013
												This game is so ♥♥♥♥ing bad. Now that is off of my chest I can review this game. Yes, it deserves the controversy. It shamelessly steals ideas from DayZ without trying to reinvent them. Ai is dumb, there is an outrageous number of hackers on this game, ammo is impossible to find, and stealth is broken. This game has it's scarce 1 of a kind moments when youre with friends, but you can have a better time by playing other games. So when you want to play a survival game, DO NOT think of this game. This is the bane of me. Also the amount of glitches are CRAZY. There are too many for me to point out. Just don't get this and wait for DayZ Standalone. Just awful. 2/10.Edit: They changed it's name to Infestation: Survivor Stories to make it seem like a different game. A very shady technique indeed. Because of their dishonesty I shall give it a new rating! 1/10.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												I purchased this game during a Steam Summer Sale since I couldn't get the DayZ mod to work on ARMA. Had over 200+ hours of play with this game and had a respectable cache of guns ammo backpacks rare items ect. Then my account was hacked and everything was stolen. Went through proper steps to contact support and hoping support could see my account was accessed from a different IP or something and possibly get my items restored. After 2 MONTHS of waiting on my "pending" ticket, I was told they wouldn't restore my items and was told something to the effect of "all the items that were stolen from you are still available in-game for me to start over and restore what was stolen." SO I'M SUPPOSED TO SPEND ANOTHER 200+ HOURS TO GET MY CACHE BACK??? ♥♥♥♥ THAT AND ♥♥♥♥ YOU customer support. I'm glad Reddit.com and Metecritic.com ripped you apart with their reviews. The game is fun and can be frustrating since it's a PvP which means everyone will KOS you even if you have no gear just to be a prick but dont expect any help from support if something goes wrong. DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. GAME.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2015
												To save you from the trouble of paying for this, there is a free version available.From the beginning: This game was released as "WarZ" -more to the point of a DayZ ripoff. Now, DayZ started as a mod for ArmA 2: Operation Arrowhead. This game is stand-alone and tries hard to accomplish the same features but fail. You'll find more information here: http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198073411359/recommended/349700/This game was very disliked for having false information and missing features, until steam pulled it off the store.It was still being developed and soon put back here as Infestation: Survivor Stories.After a while, a free version also popped up called Romero's Aftermath. I'm not even sure they have the right's to that name!But search "Romero's Aftermath on the store to play the free version, saves you the trouble and money.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 22, 2013
												Updated as of the 6th of Feburary, 2015.I have recently replayed this game and although the situation has improved it is still scummy as ♥♥♥♥.Let's avoid the contraversies, and focus on the game first.Infestation : Survivor Stories or  ISS as it is known now is a Deathmatch. Simply put, everyone and everything wants you dead. You may be swayed by a ranking but good/bad ratings are completely useless and do not tell you if someone is about to slaughter you or not. Jumping to conclusions with Lawmen often gets you killed, at least Bandits you can spot from a mile away. There are no bonuses for either morality, which make it more of a "How many bandits/bambis have you killed" counter.The Zombies are actually a little bit more interesting than anything out thus far which to be fair is a compliment, there is an actual infection statistic and you can only cure yourself with vaccines which makes things interesting PVE wise. Super Zombies are infrequent but they do happen and you need to take a different approach to them, by gunning them down with alot of shotgun rounds. This game has alot of room for a PVE approach, alot more than anything else on the market currently.Unfortunately the game has a extremely heavy PVP focus, like so much PVP its actually insane. It is actually worse than DayZ or anything else. It doesn't matter what you have, just expect to get gunned down. To help yourself enjoy the game more, just gun down everybody with a weapon. Anyone with a melee weapon is to be dealt with at range and anyone with a gun on their back is a KOS. If you really don't care, gun down literally everyone but you won't earn my respect. (Not that you'll care.)The only way to avoid PVP in this game is to either join a server with no people on it or to buy a stupid amount of GC, buy a private server and regulate it 24 ♥♥♥♥ing 7. A DayZ Hive Private server didn't require such commitment, seriously. For what reason, we'll elaborate upon soon.There are a heavy variety of guns, an almost stupid amount. There are like 4 Machine Guns in the game, a ton of assault rifles, smgs, pistols and that isn't even including the melee weapons. It is a welcome variety from the fickle arsenals of other zombie sandbox games. There are an equally large amount of attachments and devices which to use with your weapons.  You can kit yourself in some standard armour and headwear but the military based stuff is a little limited in places. Your not going to find a ghillie suit if that is what you wanted. The game has its basic survival sandbox tropes, eating food and water, having constructable barricades and being able to make a fort in a stronghold server. Which you need to also pay GC for and i'll be elaborating upon this also.The gameplay is fun and that is the strangest thing. It isn't unplayable by any particular means, it is no less bland than any of the other zombie survival sandbox games. You'll enjoy leveling up your character and completing missions and killing zombies for your XP. The world, colorado in particular is not a well designed environment. If i was to praise H1Z1 for anything, its that you are never bored for too long and that you will at least run into something vaguely interesting as long as you are going in the right places. Sometimes Infestation feels like a grating experience from walking mile after mile to picking weapon after to weapon before you finally either turn tail back to the safe zone or get shot in the head by some remorseless player. The funny thing is that i don't blame people for being like that. Not at all.The game is designed as a hoarding game. You see, when players return to a safe zone they can store their gear. Now, unlike a game like World of Warcraft or Elder Scrolls Online you do not have a limit to the amount of weapons you can throw in there. Hell, you don't have a limit for ANYTHING. It becomes rather futile as you'll pick up like 5 of this SMG or a godzillian amounts of .22 rifles and then the issue becomes ammunition or what you don't have. Usually the sniper rifles and the rarer assault rifles and machine guns. (Blazer and Honey Badger in particular.) The easiest way to get those items are to just flat out go on a murder spree on everyone or kill a super zombie. Killing a player uses less ammo, and a super zombie takes upwards of 15 to 25 Shotgun rounds, and multiple clips of machine gun ammo. Which frankly is a farce. And the sky is ♥♥♥♥ing limit, so there is no reason to stop killing people because you never feel safe enough in servers to take out your sniper rifle or machine gun. So you'll take one from some other prat that has gone on a murderbonerific spree.Now back that up with the fact there is no actual backlash for going on a murder rampage and you have yourself a PVP slaughterhouse, with the occasional player trying to haul their stuff back to the safe zone only to have a bandit to jump out of the darkness and blow his brains out. That isn't even mentioning the amounts of script kiddies that go on Unknown Cheats or ♥♥♥♥, i don't know. The amounts of people crying babying on the forums is an obvious sign of that. It happened multiple times throughout the game's lifetime and ive never had to take a glance at all this♥♥♥♥♥♥from H1Z1 or hell even DayZ. Just stop reading if you expect a fair game, because this game is filled with people that have ESPs,Wallhacks, Aimbots. It used to be ALOT worse and it might seem like it has calmed down but Hackers are absolutely rampant on this game.You'd imagine there would be some sort of mechanic or hell a PVE only mode for servers with all this murder going on but here is what i am going to talk about. What you all wanted to hear from the moment you started reading this review.We all know of this game's horrific development cycle. Sergei Titov's antics with Kewk and whatnot. The fact that the developer of big rigs over the road racing oversaw this♥♥♥♥♥♥for most people is going to sound sirens and they absolutely 100% deserve to walk away from this one. The only people i would ever recommend this game to are people like me who are absolutely crazy about this genre for some obtuse reason or 13 year old kids who enjoy zombie games.The reason we can't have a PVE only mode? The reason why we can only create legitimate bases within Stronghold and not in the open world like DayZ or H1Z1? Hell, the reason why it is so expensive to maintain a server in this game?Money, they want to milk the hell out of this game and by lord have they already done it. I have to literally feel sorry for anyone that bothered to spend money on this game and that includes myself. I wish i didn't like this game's mechanics but i do have fun somewhat playing this game. In addition getting resales from people who want to make the most out of their subscriptions to hacking sites or as i like to call them, people with more money than common sense.Apparently they are making a sequel with a new team that actually gives a cow and although it sounds like a fresh start i think its too late and that the damage is already done.♥♥♥♥ Hammerpoint Interactive, ♥♥♥♥ Sergei Titov and ♥♥♥♥ this Game.The worst in 2012 and it continues to stink the ♥♥♥♥ out of every year that its been released.

Posted: March 4, 2016
												I never write reviews, but this time how can I not?I was pretty hyped about this game. Looked fun as hell.Me and my team mate get on to play and honestly if done right, it would be a very fun game.BUTIt is a load of caca instead.The game was made so poorly that even on low settings it will freeze and crash a good computer that can runall other games just fine.When you can get a computer to run it, the servers boot you off without warning every 2-5 minutes. Both of which make the game totally unplayable.Oh and if this game was every fixed, and made into the game it had potential to be, they need a better/more realistic looting system. & the weapons need to be more accurate especially the scopesand my fps ranged from 0 - 20 only! & the item descriptions need to be detailed properly (such as one backpack tells you how many slots it has, while another does not. all items are like that). so that needs to be worked on. Also the griefers are a bit ridiculous.but with all its really bad issues, thats the least of your worries!!!The Devs have obviously said a big F U to the players and I dont see this game ever being fixed. Thats really sad.So many games go this way these days. It has become so bad I am about to stop supporting indie games! How sad is that?

content:
Posted: May 28, 2016
												I bought this game a couple of years ago, it was then released as "WarZ".I was being a fool to myself, having too much hope and expectations for this game, don't blame me - the pictures looked great! It's quite a long time ago since I played this "game", and I wouldn't expect it to change much. As soon as the game was released and started getting bad reviews, the developers thought that it was a good call to change the name into something else, just to keep milking people's wallets... The game sucks and the developers are a disgrace. Do not buy this game!After getting the launcher up, I tried resetting my password, which I couldn't manage. The reasoning of this was the message I got when I entered the mail address that I knew as the correct one, but only got "Message delivery failed..." as a response.The folder that gets created when you install the game does still have the same old name: "The War Z"TL;DR: I just bought this game, only to warn you not to. I didn't want to actually start the game, but I had to... Only to make this review... :(

												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

content:
Posted: March 13, 2015
												Have you ever wondered how a DayZ ripoff made by a greedy 12 year old with basic programming skills would look like?Well i guess it would kinda look like WarZ... um i mean Infestation: Survivor Stories!It's been a while since i played it tbh but back then (in the good old days) it was a mess. You run out of a save zone and if you're lucky and don't get shot directly outside of it's border you might get some loot. As soon as you find the loot you may want to bring some back to your stash or whatever they call it so you go back to the safe zone where 5 peole sit in the bushes and wait for your return. They probably didn't get their stuff from towns infested by buggy zombies. They may have bought it in the store for real money. Yes, there is a store for stuff. They don't sell weapons as far as i know but ammo, food, water, hats, and modifikations for the guns these ******* loot from your corpse.So you're dead. Congratulations. What now? Um, how about you pay some real money to resurrect your character? Or you spend the next few hours to repeat the same thing with a new character.I didn't mention the game mechanics did i? Well it's basically point and klick. You point on the head an klick. Sounds like a normal fps? Nope, most fps have some more complicated mechanics than that but if you don't like it you can still run around and beat other people with a flashlight because that's the most fun you can have in this game because it's not about surviving in a zombie apocalypse. It's about your wallet.0/10 because the CEO of Hammerpoint isn't in jailSmall Edit: 0.2 hrs because i played the non-steam-version.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												Pros:-Graphically the game looks good.-Decent Loot in the game is fairly easy to achieve if you know where those spawns are.-The Dynamic Lighting looks great. (SweetFX makes it greater)-Fairly Decent sized open world. (but could use some more fillers to block out the dreaded walking)-Character Customization is neat. (but requires you to have to pay either GC or GD to unlock some which this serves as both a con and pro)-Finding a rare item can be exhilarating at times.-Loot Hoarding is always great. (This is one Key feature why I like Infestation most about)-Having your very own Unlimited GI .(Global Inventory)Cons:-Game has a lot of potential, Devs refuse to maximize that potential.-No matter what the devs tell you about this being a PVE based game is a lie and focuses towards PVP, very hard to keep the loot you find without some Jacka** killing you on sight.-Large FPS drops in certain areas as well as FPS hickups (This happens even on high end computers). Large cities that require a lot of rendering have a lot of FPS drops Campos on v2 being one.-Leveling is fairly slow-This game is pretty hard to play without some sort of GC start up fund as a new player to Infestation. Which I recommend getting at least one of the GC packs otherwise you'll have a hard time with no items in your GI. (Overall isn't fair to have to purchase more to the game to actually enjoy it)-Little options to lower resolution on lower end PC's.-Lots of bugs the community constantly complains about, but never get fixed in patches until far later.-Loads of Punkbuster issues with this game, Some Kicks, Some Temperary false bans, Others like myself getting Computer freezes/Lockups where a hard reset will only work.-People Being Falsely banned. (Supposidly, which really I think is because they have Keyloggers on their PC's)-Development in this game is pretty slow.-Things being promised, but never happen.-Customer Support is god awefully slow.-Developers make up pity excuses, whether it's based on your ban, features, implementations, etc.-False Advertising.-Very limited Zombie Models. (After a while of seeing the same NPC's they get stale real quick)-Animations are very limited and lack (Melee weapons Especially, Same animation over and over)-Lot of Hackers in this game that  have one goal, to kill you unfairly and steal your items and sell their account with your items and many other peoples items for a real profit.Overall:This game has a lot of potential, why the devs hold back, will never know. This game is getting better, but very slowly. The biggest issue in this game are the FPS problems. Owning an Nvidia Geforce GTX 470 GPU and an i7 CPU I should not be getting 5-10 FPS in Large cities, something isn't right. I can't say the devs are a scam, otherwise they'd stop further development of this game, but still doesnt make up the excuse why it's so slow in development. So would I recommend to buy this game? No, however it is enjoyable at times, but with the bugs and issues this game has as well as in the company, a lot needs to be changed before I can give a better review. So I'd wait for a better outcome on this game to be honest, if it gets that far. Don't get me wrong I play this a lot based on hours as you can see, it's just those enjoyable moments as I was saying is why I still play, and the Loot hoarding which is a special feature to have a GI while no other game has done (Besides Nether, but Nether is just as worse as this game don't know why people recommend it over this game I've seen Youtube reviews of the game that were just, bad).
